adjective.description: Not consistent or having a fixed pattern; liable to change.
examples: the quality of hospital food is highly variable
awards can be for variable amounts

adjective.description: Able to be changed or adapted.

noun.description: An element, feature, or factor that is liable to vary or change.
examples: there are too many variables involved to make any meaningful predictions

origin: Late Middle English: via Old French from Latin variabilis, from variare (see vary).
